page.title: 01RURAL TYBERTON
page.content: This area is used predominately for agriculture apart fron a large belt of woodland covering the hill known as Stockley Hill, which splits the area into two parts. The area to the east of Stockley Hill is intensively farmed, there are two dairy farms in the village of Tyberton itself, one arable farm at Chustone and a small nusied unit in the village of Shenmore. To the west of Stockley Hill the land is put down to grass used for grazing. The woodland itself is productive in that it supports the rearing of pheasants for a shoot over the area and the hard and soft woods in it are grown and replaced commercially.
